turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Sprint canoe.
turn.1: What is the history of Women in canoeing?
turn.2: International works to push sprint canoe organizations to include more events for women's canoe.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: WomenCAN is led by American canoeist Pamela Boteler, who made canoe-kayak history in the 2000 National Championships by becoming the first woman to compete in sprint canoe, against the men, winning gold and bronze medals.
turn.5: Did they have any other accomplishments?
turn.6: In 2002, Boteler's lobbying convinced USA Canoe-Kayak to allow women to compete at the National Championships in their own events.
turn.7: What is the most important fact in this article?
turn.8: Boats are symmetrical along the length and are only paddled on one side, paddlers use what is called a J stroke to keep their boats straight while they paddle.
turn.9: What is the most interesting fact in this article?
turn.10: Paddlers kneel on a foam or cushioned block to stabilize their knee, and boats often have foot braces to secure position.
turn.11: What types of boats are used?
turn.12: ICF boat types are C-1, C-2, C-4..
